info.title: TimeZoneDB - Find Local Time Zone by Coordinate or Name
info.description: TimeZoneDB finds you the local time zone of a place by latitude & longitude, or by the time zone name such as "Europe/London". You get local time in Unix timestamp, with GMT offset, daylight saving, and country code.

get.description: Return country code, GMT offset, daylight saving time, time zone name, and current timestamp.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: The forat of the returned result. Default is XML formatted.

parameters.name: lat
parameters.description: Latitude of a city. This field is required when "zone" is not specified.

parameters.name: lng
parameters.description: Longitude of a city. This field is required when "zone" is not specified.

parameters.name: time
parameters.description: Unix timestamp to be converted into local time. For more information of Unix time, please refer to http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Unix_time

parameters.name: zone
parameters.description: Time zone name . You can refer the name from http://timezonedb.com/time-zones. Required if lat & lng fields are not provided.
